member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentInfo
member.summary: This class provides static information about the Framework's Agent.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentInfo.GetAgentMutexId(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the name of the mutex that can be used to determine if an Agent is running. You must supply the service name.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentInfo.GetInfoServiceAddress(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the name of the information service address for the Agent's WCF information service given a service name.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentInfo.GetLogServiceAddress(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the name of the log service address that the Agent is using. You must supply the appropriate service name.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentInfo.IsAgentRunning(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a boolean indicating if the Agent is currently running on the machine.
member.remarks: This static method is provided for anyone who might want to insure that the Agent is running before calling an Agent function. Under normal situations, the Agent is always running as a service so this method would normally always return true.

example.code: if (AgentInfo.IsAgentRunning()) // call the agent to do something

member.returns: Returns true if the agent is running, or false if it is not.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginPolicy.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor required for XmlSerializer

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginPolicy.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize the class with the specified identifier and data

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentPolicies
member.summary: This object defines the Agent's policies.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentPolicies.RebootPolicy
member.summary: Specifies the password to use when taking ownership.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentPolicies.PluginPolicies
member.summary: Plugin policies

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentPolicies.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentPolicies.Sequence
member.summary: The current sequence number of this policy.
member.remarks: A value of -1 indicates no policy. CMG Server will increment this value everytime it sends a new policy.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.BaseThread.OnThreadEntry
member.summary: This is the entry point of the thread. It gets called when the thread first starts. This class sets a exception handler for any unhandled exception and then calls the virtual method so that derived classes can start processing.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.BaseThread.SetThreadName
member.summary: This private method sets the name of the thread. This is used for debugging purposes.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.BaseThread.ThreadName
member.summary: This property gets or sets the thread name.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.GetAppGuid
member.summary: Returns the GUID of the application assembly.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.IsRunAsAdmin
member.summary: Returns true if the current process is running as an administrator.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.RunUserProcessAsAdmin(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Starts a process in the currently logged on user's desktop and bypasses UAC

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.BringAppToFront(System.String)
member.summary: Finds an application by window title and makes it the foreground window. It will restore a previously minimized window.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.BringAppToFront(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Finds an application by window handle and makes it the foreground window. It will restore a previously minimized window.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.SetWindowPosFlags.AsynchronousWindowPosition
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.
member.remarks: SWP_ASYNCWINDOWPOS

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.SetWindowPosFlags.DeferErase
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.
member.remarks: SWP_DEFERERASE

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.SetWindowPosFlags.DrawFrame
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.
member.remarks: SWP_DRAWFRAME

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.SetWindowPosFlags.FrameChanged
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.
member.remarks: SWP_FRAMECHANGED

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.SetWindowPosFlags.HideWindow
member.summary: Hides the window.
member.remarks: SWP_HIDEWINDOW

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.SetWindowPosFlags.DoNotActivate
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).
member.remarks: SWP_NOACTIVATE

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.SetWindowPosFlags.DoNotCopyBits
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.
member.remarks: SWP_NOCOPYBITS

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.SetWindowPosFlags.IgnoreMove
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).
member.remarks: SWP_NOMOVE

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.SetWindowPosFlags.DoNotChangeOwnerZOrder
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.
member.remarks: SWP_NOOWNERZORDER

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.SetWindowPosFlags.DoNotRedraw
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.
member.remarks: SWP_NOREDRAW

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.SetWindowPosFlags.DoNotReposition
member.summary: Same as the SWP_NOOWNERZORDER flag.
member.remarks: SWP_NOREPOSITION

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.SetWindowPosFlags.DoNotSendChangingEvent
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.
member.remarks: SWP_NOSENDCHANGING

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.SetWindowPosFlags.IgnoreResize
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).
member.remarks: SWP_NOSIZE

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.SetWindowPosFlags.IgnoreZOrder
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).
member.remarks: SWP_NOZORDER

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AppHelper.SetWindowPosFlags.ShowWindow
member.summary: Displays the window.
member.remarks: SWP_SHOWWINDOW

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentPluginInfo
member.summary: This object defines all the reporting information about an Agent "plugin", such as the Bitlocker or TPM plugins.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentPluginInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentPluginInfo.PluginName
member.summary: The name of the plugin - e.g. "BitLocker Management Provider"

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentPluginInfo.PluginGuid
member.summary: The unique ID that identifies this plugin

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentPluginInfo.PluginVersion
member.summary: The version of the plugin - e.g. "1.0.3"

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentPluginInfo.PluginApiVersion
member.summary: The version of the interface - e.g. "1.0"

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentPluginInfo.PluginDescription
member.summary: This description of the plugin

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentPluginInfo.PluginEnabled
member.summary: This value indicates whether the plugin has been enabled by policy.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentPluginInfo.PluginState
member.summary: This is a plugin-specific value that indicates the state of the plugin.
member.remarks: Currently, this string value is specific to each plugin and will be in the locale of the client machine.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.AgentPluginInfo.PoliciesEnforced
member.summary: This value indicates whether the plugin has determined that all of its current policies are in force.
member.remarks: For the machine-level PoliciesEnforced value to be true, all plugins must also report that policies are enforced.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferCreateLevel(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferLevelScope,Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferLevel,Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferOpen,System.IntPtr@,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The SaferCreateLevel function opens a SAFER_LEVEL_HANDLE.
member.param: The scope of the level to be created.
The level of the handle to be opened.
The returned SAFER_LEVEL_HANDLE. When you have finished using the handle, release it by calling the SaferCloseLevel function.
This parameter is reserved for future use. IntPtr.Zero

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferComputeTokenFromLevel(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr@,Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferTokenBehaviour,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The SaferComputeTokenFromLevel function restricts a token using restrictions specified by a SAFER_LEVEL_HANDLE.
member.param: SAFER_LEVEL_HANDLE that contains the restrictions to place on the input token. Do not pass handles with a LevelId of SAFER_LEVELID_FULLYTRUSTED or SAFER_LEVELID_DISALLOWED to this function. This is because SAFER_LEVELID_FULLYTRUSTED is unrestricted and SAFER_LEVELID_DISALLOWED does not contain a token.
Token to be restricted. If this parameter is NULL, the token of the current thread will be used. If the current thread does not contain a token, the token of the current process is used.
Specifies the behavior of the method.
Reserved for future use. This parameter should be set to IntPtr.EmptyParam.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferCloseLevel(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The SaferCloseLevel function closes a SAFER_LEVEL_HANDLE that was opened by using the SaferIdentifyLevel function or the SaferCreateLevel function.
member.returns: TRUE if the function succeeds; otherwise, FALSE. For extended error information, call GetLastWin32Error.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferTokenBehaviour
member.summary: Specifies the behaviour of the SaferComputeTokenFromLevel method

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferTokenBehaviour.NullIfEqual
member.summary: If the OutAccessToken parameter is not more restrictive than the InAccessToken parameter, the OutAccessToken parameter returns NULL.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferLevel
member.summary: The level of the handle to be opened.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferLevel.Disallowed
member.summary: Software will not run, regardless of the user rights of the user.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferLevel.Untrusted
member.summary: Allows programs to execute with access only to resources granted to open well-known groups, blocking access to Administrator and Power User privileges and personally granted rights.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferLevel.Constrained
member.summary: Software cannot access certain resources, such as cryptographic keys and credentials, regardless of the user rights of the user.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferLevel.NormalUser
member.summary: Allows programs to execute as a user that does not have Administrator or Power User user rights. Software can access resources accessible by normal users.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferLevel.FullyTrusted
member.summary: Software user rights are determined by the user rights of the user.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferLevelScope
member.summary: The scope of the level to be created.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferLevelScope.Machine
member.summary: The created level is scoped by computer.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.WinSafer.SaferLevelScope.User
member.summary: The created level is scoped by user.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiBaseBoardInfo
member.summary: This object contains information about a machine's motherboard or system board.

remarks.para: This object provides a C# front-end to various properties in the Win32_BaseBoard WMI class.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiBaseBoardInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiBaseBoardInfo.Refresh(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiBaseBoardInfo@,System.String)
member.summary: Refresh the given WMI object if necessary.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiBaseBoardInfo.Manufacturer
member.summary: The name of the organization responsible for manufacturing the motherboard - e.g. "Dell Inc."

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiBaseBoardInfo.SerialNumber
member.summary: The manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the motherboard - e.g. ".B7F3BK1.CN129619E2335".
member.remarks: It has been determined that the use of the motherboard serial number works best for uniquely identifying a machine.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiBiosInfo
member.summary: This object contains information about a machine's BIOS.

remarks.para: This object provides a C# front-end to various properties in the Win32_BIOS WMI class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiBiosInfo.Refresh(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiBiosInfo@,System.String)
member.summary: Refresh the given WMI object if necessary.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiBiosInfo.Name
member.summary: Name of the BIOS - e.g. "Phoenix ROM BIOS PLUS Version 1.10 A24"

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiBiosInfo.Manufacturer
member.summary: The manufacturer of the BIOS - e.g. "Dell Inc."

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiBiosInfo.SerialNumber
member.summary: The serial number of the BIOS - e.g. "B7F3BK1".

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiBiosInfo.Version
member.summary: The version of the BIOS - e.g. "DELL - 27da0813"

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiBiosInfo.SMBiosVersion
member.summary: The BIOS version as reported by SMBIOS - e.g. "2.4"

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.DiskDriveMediaType
member.summary: This enumeration specifies drive's media type.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.DiskDriveMediaType.Unknown
member.summary: The media type is unknown.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.DiskDriveMediaType.Fixed
member.summary: The media is fixed.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.DiskDriveMediaType.Removable
member.summary: The media is removable.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.DiskDriveMediaType.External
member.summary: The media is external.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo
member.summary: This object contains information about a disk drive.

remarks.para: This object provides a C# front-end to various properties in the Win32_DiskDrive WMI class.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo.ResetEncryptionInfo
member.summary: This method resets all of the encryption information for a given drive.
member.example: After calling this function, this drive and all its partitions will have newly constructed encryption information objects.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo.GetDiskDriveFromLogicalDisk(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Given a computerName and logical disk (i.ex. "C:") return a DiskDriveInfo.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo.GetMediaType(System.Management.ManagementBaseObject)
member.summary: This helper function returns an enumeration that helps us categorize the media type from the MediaType string that we receive from the WMI object. If desired, we could move this function into the WmiDiskDriveInfo class and always keep the enumeration in here.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo.GetSerialNumber(System.Management.ManagementBaseObject,Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.DiskDriveMediaType)
member.summary: This method determines a unique serial number from the given WMI object. In the case of removable media, the SerialNumber property is not valid. So we parse the end of the PNPDeviceID to get what we hope is a unique ID. The PNPDeviceID looks something like: USBSTOR\DISK.VEN_MEMOREX.PROD_MINI_TRAVELDRIVE.REV_6.17\0BE1B56160E19880.0 We extract everything past the last '\' and use that for a unique ID.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo.UniqueID
member.summary: A value that may be used to uniquely identify the disk drive on the system.
member.remarks: This value is the same as the serial number if no Model is detected, otherwise it consists of a concatenated model and serial number.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo.DeviceID
member.summary: Operating system identifier of the disk drive with other devices on the system.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo.DiskIndex
member.summary: Physical drive number of the given drive. A value of -1 indicates that the given drive does not map to a physical drive.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo.Size
member.summary: Size of the disk drive. It is calculated by multiplying the total number of cylinders, tracks in each cylinder, sectors in each track, and bytes in each sector.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo.Model
member.summary: Manufacturer's model number of the disk drive. Example: "ST32171W"

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo.SerialNumber
member.summary: Number allocated by the manufacturer to identify the physical media. Example: "WD-WM3493798728".

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo.MediaType
member.summary: Specifies the type of media for the disk drive.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo.InterfaceType
member.summary: Specifies an interface type for the disk drive - e.g. ("USB")

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo.EncryptionInfo
member.summary: Specifies the disk drive's encryption information.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskDriveInfo.DiskPartitions
member.summary: Contains an array of object - one for each partition that is allocated on the disk drive.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskPartitionInfo
member.summary: This object contains information about a disk partition.

remarks.para: This object provides a C# front-end to various properties in the Win32_DiskPartition WMI class.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskPartitionInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskPartitionInfo.ResetEncryptionInfo
member.summary: This method resets all of the encryption information for a given partition.
member.example: After calling this function, this partition and all its logical drives will have newly constructed encryption information objects.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskPartitionInfo.PartitionID
member.summary: Unique identifier of the disk drive and partition, from the rest of the operating system.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskPartitionInfo.PartitionIndex
member.summary: Index number of the partition.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskPartitionInfo.PartitionSize
member.summary: Total size of the partition in bytes.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskPartitionInfo.DiskIndex
member.summary: Index of the disk containing this partition.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskPartitionInfo.EncryptionInfo
member.summary: Encryption information associated with this partition.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiDiskPartitionInfo.LogicalDisks
member.summary: List of logical disks defined in this partition.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo
member.summary: This class contains information about a encryption vendor (for example "Bitlocker") at a given encryptable unit (disk drive, partition, volume).

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.ID
member.summary: Contains the enumerated ID of the vendor - e.g. Bitlocker

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.Technology
member.summary: Contains the enumerated ID of the vendor - e.g. Bitlocker

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.UniqueID
member.summary: Contains any unique ID that the vendor may provide for the given encryptable unit. This value may be an empty string if the vendor does not supply a unique identifier.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.ProtectionStatus
member.summary: Contains the protection status of the encryptable unit.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.ConversionStatus
member.summary: Contains the encryption conversion status of the encryptable unit.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.Algorithm
member.summary: Contains the encryption algorithm of the encryptable unit.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.EncryptionPercentage
member.summary: Contains the encryption percentage of the encryptable unit from 0.0 to 100.0.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.VendorID
member.summary: This enumeration specifies a specific vendor ID that CMG Server utilizes.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.VendorID.Unknown
member.summary: The encryption vendor is unknown.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.VendorID.BitLocker
member.summary: The encryption vendor is Microsoft's BitLocker

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.VendorID.CredantSED
member.summary: The encryption vendor is Credant's SED manager

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.VendorID.DDPE
member.summary: The encryption vendor is DDPE

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.VendorTechnology
member.summary: Defines the various types of encryption techologies

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.VendorTechnology.Unknown
member.summary: The technology is unknown or at default state.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.VendorTechnology.SelfEncryptingDrive
member.summary: The technology is a self-encrypting drive

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.VendorTechnology.VolumeEncryption
member.summary: The technology is a volume-based encryption, such as BitLocker.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.VendorTechnology.FileFolderEncryption
member.summary: The technology is a file/folder-based encryption, such as CMG Shield or EFS

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo.VendorTechnology.FullDiskEncryption
member.summary: The technology is a full-disk encryption technology, such as FVE with GPE

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiLogicalDiskInfo
member.summary: This object contains information about a logical disk (volume). There may be multiple logical disks in a object.

remarks.para: This object provides a C# front-end to various properties in the Win32_LogicalDisk WMI class.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiLogicalDiskInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiLogicalDiskInfo.ResetEncryptionInfo
member.summary: This method resets the encryption information for this logical disk.
member.example: After calling this function, the encryption information will be at default state.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiLogicalDiskInfo.DiskId
member.summary: Unique identifier of the logical disk from other devices on the system - e.g. "C:"

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiLogicalDiskInfo.Name
member.summary: Volume name of this logical disk or an empty string if none was specified by the user.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiLogicalDiskInfo.Description
member.summary: A description of this logical disk - e.g. "Local Fixed Disk"

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiLogicalDiskInfo.SerialNumber
member.summary: A serial number of the logical disk - e.g. "A036C39B".
member.remarks: Note that this serial is not guaranteed to be unique.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiLogicalDiskInfo.DriveType
member.summary: The type of logical disk - e.g. "LocalDisk"

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiLogicalDiskInfo.MediaType
member.summary: The type of media of the logical disk - e.g. "FixedMedia"

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiLogicalDiskInfo.FileSystem
member.summary: The file system on the logical disk - e.g. "NTFS" or "FAT32", etc.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiLogicalDiskInfo.TotalSpace
member.summary: Total space, in bytes, allocated on the logical disk.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiLogicalDiskInfo.FreeSpace
member.summary: Space, in bytes, currently available (free) on the logical disk.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiLogicalDiskInfo.EncryptionInfo
member.summary: Encryption information associated with this logical disk.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMachineInfo
member.summary: This object contains all inventory information about a given machine.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMachineInfo.osInfo
member.summary: Contains inventory information about the operating system.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMachineInfo.biosInfo
member.summary: Contains inventory information about the machine's BIOS.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMachineInfo.memoryInfo
member.summary: Contains inventory information about the machine's memory configuration.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMachineInfo.tpmInfo
member.summary: Contains inventory information about the machine's TPM device.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMachineInfo.baseBoardInfo
member.summary: Contains inventory information about the machine's motherboard.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMachineInfo.processors
member.summary: Contains inventory information about the machine's processors.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMachineInfo.diskDrives
member.summary: Contains inventory information about the machine's disk drives.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMachineInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMachineInfo.ProtectionStatus
member.summary: Contains the machine-level encryption protection status which is a roll-up of all the disk drives' encryption protection status value.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMachineInfo.ProtectionStatusDateTime
member.summary: Contains the date and time that the machine's became protected. This is used for auditing purposes.
member.remarks: Note that this value contains the date/time that the machine was last protected, but does not guarantee that the machine is protected.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMemoryInfo
member.summary: This object contains information about a machine's memory configuration.
member.remarks: This object provides a C# front-end to various properties in the Win32_OperatingSystem WMI class.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMemoryInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMemoryInfo.Refresh(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMemoryInfo@,System.String)
member.summary: Refresh the given WMI object if necessary.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMemoryInfo.TotalPhysicalMemory
member.summary: Total amount, in kilobytes, of physical memory available to the operating system. This value does not necessarily indicate the true amount of physical memory, but what is reported to the operating system as available to it.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMemoryInfo.AvailablePhysicalMemory
member.summary: Number, in kilobytes, of physical memory currently unused and available.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMemoryInfo.TotalVirtualMemory
member.summary: Number, in kilobytes, of virtual memory.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiMemoryInfo.AvailableVirtualMemory
member.summary: Number, in kilobytes, of virtual memory currently unused and available.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiOpSysInfo
member.summary: This object contains information about a operating system that is currently running on a machine.
member.remarks: This object provides a C# front-end to various properties in the Win32_OperatingSystem WMI class.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiOpSysInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiOpSysInfo.Refresh(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiOpSysInfo@,System.String)
member.summary: Refresh the given WMI object if necessary.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiOpSysInfo.Name
member.summary: Short description of the objectâ€”a one-line string. The string includes the operating system version. For example, "Microsoft Windows XP Professional Version = 5.1.2500". This property can be localized.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiOpSysInfo.Version
member.summary: Version number of the operating system. Example: "4.0"

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiOpSysInfo.Architecture
member.summary: Architecture of the operating system, as opposed to the processor. Example: "32-bit"

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiOpSysInfo.SerialNumber
member.summary: Operating system product serial identification number. Example: "10497-OEM-0031416-71674

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiOpSysInfo.Organization
member.summary: Company name for the registered user of the operating system. Example: "Microsoft Corporation"

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiOpSysInfo.RegisteredUser
member.summary: Name of the registered user of the operating system. Example: "Doug Gillespie"

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiOpSysInfo.InstallDate
member.summary: Date object was installed. This property does not require a value to indicate that the object is installed.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiOpSysInfo.LastBootTime
member.summary: Date and time the operating system was last restarted.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiProcessorInfo
member.summary: This object contains information about a machine's processor.

remarks.para: This object provides a C# front-end to various properties in the Win32_Processor WMI class.
A machine may have more than one processor so there may be multiple objects in the object.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiProcessorInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiProcessorInfo.DeviceID
member.summary: Unique identifier of a processor on the system.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiProcessorInfo.Name
member.summary: The label by which the processor is known in the OS.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiProcessorInfo.Description
member.summary: The description of the processor.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiProcessorInfo.ProcessorId
member.summary: An identifier associated with the processor.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiProcessorInfo.NumCores
member.summary: Number of cores for the current instance of the processor. A core is a physical processor on the integrated circuit. For example, in a dual-core processor this property has a value of 2.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiProcessorInfo.MaxClockSpeed
member.summary: Maximum speed of the processor, in MHz.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiProcessorInfo.CurrentClockSpeed
member.summary: Current speed of the processor, in MHz.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiSystemEnclosureInfo
member.summary: This object contains information about a WMI_SystemEnclosure

remarks.para: This object provides a C# front-end to various properties in the Win32_SystemEnclosure WMI class.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiSystemEnclosureInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiSystemEnclosureInfo.Refresh(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiSystemEnclosureInfo@,System.String)
member.summary: Refresh the given WMI object if necessary.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiSystemEnclosureInfo.SMBIOSAssetTag
member.summary: The asset tag from the BIOS

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiSystemEnclosureInfo.SerialNumber
member.summary: The manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the motherboard - e.g. ".B7F3BK1.CN129619E2335".
member.remarks: It has been determined that the use of the motherboard serial number works best for uniquely identifying a machine.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiTpmInfo
member.summary: This object contains information about a machine's TPM device.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiTpmInfo.IsPresent
member.summary: This property is set to true if a TPM device was detected by the operating system. If this value is false, all other properties in this class should be ignored.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiTpmInfo.IsEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether the TPM is enabled.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiTpmInfo.IsOwned
member.summary: Indicates whether the TPM has an owner.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiTpmInfo.IsActivated
member.summary: Indicates whether the TPM is activated.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiTpmInfo.ManufacturerId
member.summary: The identifying information that uniquely names the TPM manufacturer - e.g. ("BRCM")
member.remarks: When the data is unavailable, an empty string is returned, otherwise it will be a string of up to 4 characters indicating the manufacturer.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiTpmInfo.ManufacturerVersion
member.summary: The version of the TPM as specified by the manufacturer - e.g. ("6.2")
member.remarks: When the data is unavailable, an empty string is returned.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiTpmInfo.SpecVersion
member.summary: The version of the Trusted Computing Group (TCG) specification that the TPM supports.
member.remarks: This value includes the major and minor TCG specification version, the specification revision level, and the errata revision level. All values are in hexadecimal. For example, a version information of "1.2, 2, 0" indicates that the device was implemented to TCG specification version 1.2, revision level 2, and with no errata.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.WmiTpmInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionProtectionStatus
member.summary: This enumeration specifies an encryption protection status. It is used at the volume, partition, disk, and machine levels.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionProtectionStatus.Default
member.summary: The data is in default or initialized state.
member.remarks: This value will be set at object construction. It means that no attempt to determine the protection status has yet been made. Note this is different from "Unknown".

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionProtectionStatus.Protected
member.summary: The data is fully protected.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionProtectionStatus.Unprotected
member.summary: The data is not protected.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionProtectionStatus.Locked
member.summary: The data is locked and inaccessible.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionProtectionStatus.Unknown
member.summary: An attempt was made to determine the status and the result is unknown. The data could be protected, but should be assumed to unprotected for auditing purposes.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionProtectedReason
member.summary: This enumeration specifies why the volume, partition, or disk is protected

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionProtectedReason.Default
member.summary: Not protected - default value

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionProtectedReason.VendorProtected
member.summary: Protected because a Vendor reported that it was protected

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionProtectedReason.AllPartitionsProtected
member.summary: Protected because all partitions are protected

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionProtectedReason.AllLogDisksProtected
member.summary: Protected because all volumes are protected

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionProtectedReason.ParentDriveIsProtected
member.summary: Protected because its parent drive is protected

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionProtectedReason.ParentPartitionIsProtected
member.summary: Protected because its parent partition is protected

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionConversionStatus
member.summary: This enumeration specifies an encryption conversion status.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionConversionStatus.Unknown
member.summary: The conversion status is unknown.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionConversionStatus.FullyDecrypted
member.summary: The data is fully decrypted.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionConversionStatus.FullyEncrypted
member.summary: The data is fully encrypted.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionConversionStatus.EncryptionInProgress
member.summary: The data is being encrypted.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionConversionStatus.DecryptionInProgress
member.summary: The data is being decrypted.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionConversionStatus.EncryptionPaused
member.summary: The data encryption process has been paused.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionConversionStatus.DecryptionPaused
member.summary: The data decryption process has been paused.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: This enumeration specifies an encryption algorithm.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionAlgorithm.None
member.summary: No algorithm

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionAlgorithm.AES128withDiffUser
member.summary: Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithm enhanced with a diffuser layer, using an AES key size of 128 bits.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionAlgorithm.AES256withDiffUser
member.summary: Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithm enhanced with a diffuser layer, using an AES key size of 256 bits.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionAlgorithm.AES128
member.summary: Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithm, using an AES key size of 128 bits.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionAlgorithm.AES256
member.summary: Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithm, using an AES key size of 256 bits.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionAlgorithm.Hardware
member.summary: Hardware encryption

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionAlgorithm.Unknown
member.summary: The algorithm is unknown

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionInfo
member.summary: This object contains encryption information, such as the protection status, encryption percentage, and a list of vendors providing encryption service.
member.remarks: Because encryption information is reported at the disk volume, disk partition, disk drive, and machine levels, this object is included at multiple levels of the inventory reporting.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values. Note that the Vendors property is initially set to null.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionInfo.#ctor(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionProtectionStatus,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the object with the specified initial values. Note that the Vendors property is initially set to null.
member.param: Sets the initial value of the property.
Sets the initial value of the property.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionInfo.AddVendorInfo(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionVendorInfo)
member.summary: This method adds a new EncryptionVendorInfo to the list of vendors. It will create a new list object if necessary.
member.param: The vendor information to add to the list.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionInfo.GetVendorCount
member.summary: This method returns the number of vendors in the list or 0 if none have been added yet.
member.returns: The number of vendors in the list.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionInfo.Reset
member.summary: This method resets the object to default state, including deleting all vendors in the list.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionInfo.Rollup
member.summary: This method provides a roll-up operation by setting the protection status and encryption percentages in the object based upon what each vendor has reported for their protection status and encryption percentages.

remarks.para: If there are no vendors in the list, this function does nothing.
If there is only one vendor in the list, then the object's protection status and encryption percentage will match what the vendor reported.

If there are more than one vendor in the list, then the object's protection status will be protected if any one vendor reports it is protected, and the object's encryption percentage will be the maximum encryption percentage reported by any vendor.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionInfo.ProtectionStatus
member.summary: Contains a enumerated value indicating the protection status.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionInfo.ProtectedReason
member.summary: Contains a enumerated value indicating the protection status.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionInfo.EncryptionPercentage
member.summary: Contains the encryption percentage from 0.0 to 100.0.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Discovery.EncryptionInfo.Vendors
member.summary: Contains a list of vendors that are currently providing encryption services at the level that this object is attached. Note this value can be null.
member.example: This value initially is null when indicates that there are no vendors providing encryption services at this level.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginInfo
member.summary: This class defines the information attributes that must be set on all FrameworkPlugins. To be valid, a Name, Guid Id, and Version must be specified. The Description is optional.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.FrameworkThread
member.summary: Creates and controls a thread for use in the Framework. It wraps the .NET Thread class and supplies an unhandled exception handler. It is preferred that all users of the Framework derive from this object rather than the .NET Thread class.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.FrameworkThread.StartThread
member.summary: This is the public method that is called to start the thread.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.FrameworkThread.StopThread
member.summary: This public method stops the running thread. It sets the flag that indicates the thread should stop.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.FrameworkThread.OnThreadStart
member.summary: This abstract method must be supplied by the derived class. It is called by the thread in response to a StartThread request.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.FrameworkThread.OnThreadStop
member.summary: This abtract method must be supplied by the derived class. It is called by the thread in response to a StopThread request.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.FrameworkThread.Sleep(System.Int32)
member.summary: This protected method is provided so that deriving classes can call this method to sleep for a given amount of time and have normal exceptions handled here.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.FrameworkThread.OnThreadEntry
member.summary: This is the entry point of the thread. It gets called when the thread first starts. This class sets a exception handler for any unhandled exception and then calls the virtual method so that derived classes can start processing.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.FrameworkThread.SetThreadName
member.summary: This private method sets the name of the thread. This is used for debugging purposes.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.FrameworkThread.IsThreadAlive
member.summary: This property is true if the thread is alive

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.FrameworkThread.ThreadName
member.summary: This property gets or sets the thread name.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.FrameworkThread.ThreadAborting
member.summary: This property gets or sets the flag that indicates whether or not the thread should stop.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManagerHandler
member.summary: This delegate defines an EventManager callback.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManagerArgs
member.summary: This class defines the arguments that are sent when the EventManager fires an event.

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManagerArgs.Empty
member.summary: Static empty object to be used if no arguments are required

member.name: F:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManagerArgs.Tag
member.summary: This property allows an object to be tagged to this class.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManagerArgs.#ctor
member.summary: The default constructor for this object.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManagerArgs.EventName
member.summary: This property contains the name of the event that is firing. Note that this field will only be set during the event signal.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManager
member.summary: This class provides dynamic event registration by maintaining a list of events and their names. This class is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManager.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for the class.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManager.RaiseEvent(System.String,System.Object,Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManagerArgs)
member.summary: Raises or signals the event specified in eventName. If the event does not exist it will be automatically created. This call is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManager.RaiseEvent(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log,System.String,System.Object,Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManagerArgs)
member.summary: Raises or signals the event specified in eventName. If the event does not exist it will be automatically created. This call is thread-safe.
member.param: Log object to write error messages to if an exception occurs in one of the delegates.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManager.RegisterForEvent(System.String,Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManagerHandler)
member.summary: This method registers a handler for the given event. If the event does not exist it will be automatically created. This call is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManager.DeleteEvent(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes an event by name.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManager.FindEventIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Finds an event by name and returns its index or -1 if not found.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.EventManager.GetEvent(System.String)
member.summary: Finds an event by name. If the event is not found, it will be automatically created.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.OsHelper
member.summary: Helper class for providing information about the Operating System

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.DebugHelper
member.summary: This class defines static helper functions that are useful for debugging. Note this class is only used for debug builds.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.DebugHelper.SetCulture(System.Threading.Thread,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a thread's culture directly. This is called when threads are created.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log.Write(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log.LogMsgType,System.String)
member.summary: Write a message to log file passing in the message severity

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log.Write(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log.LogMsgType,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Write a message to log file passing in the message severity

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log.Dump(System.String)
member.summary: Write Information message to log file

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log.Info(System.String)
member.summary: Write Information message to log file

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log.Warning(System.String)
member.summary: Write warning message to log file

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log.Error(System.String)
member.summary: Write error message to log file

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log.Fatal(System.String)
member.summary: Write error message to log file

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log.Debug(System.String)
member.summary: Write debug message to log file

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log.GetMsgTypeTag(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log.LogMsgType)
member.summary: Given a log message severity, return the string to use in the message header. Currently, for informational or warnings, we just return a single letter ("I" or "W" respectively). For others, we return a longer string so that errors stand out when viewing the log.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.LogFile.InitFileIndex
member.summary: Initializes the file index to the oldest created log file, or the first log slot that does not exist.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.LogFile.AdvanceFileIndex
member.summary: This is called after it has been detected that the current log file is larger than the maximum allowed size. It will advance the file index to the next sequential suffix and delete any preexisting file.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.NativeMethods.EnableShutdownPrivilege
member.summary: This method enables us to issue a shutdown by enabling this privilege.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.NativeMethods.GetActiveConsoleSessionId
member.summary: This method gets the ID of the session that is currently active. Note that we can not use the WTSGetActiveConsoleSessionId() call because it did not return the correct ID when using remote desktop.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.NativeMethods.GetAppGuid
member.summary: Returns the GUID of the application assembly.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.NativeMethods.GetUserDisplayName
member.summary: Returns the display name of the current user. If the call to display name fails, it will fall back to the Environment.Username. Note that if a user is "renamed" in Windows, the Environment.Username is not changed - only the display name.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.NativeMethods.IsAnybodyLoggedIn
member.summary: Returns true if any user is currently logged in.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.NativeMethods.IsRunAsAdmin
member.summary: Returns true if the current process is running as an administrator.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.NativeMethods.StartProcessAndBypassUAC(System.String,Dell.Client.Framework.Common.NativeMethods.PROCESS_INFORMATION@)
member.summary: Launches the given application with full admin rights, and in addition bypasses the Vista UAC prompt

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.NativeMethods.GetLoggedOnUserToken
member.summary: Returns the Token for the currently logged on user - need to call CloseHandle when complete. Returns IntPtr.Zero if error or no user is logged in.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginHelper
member.summary: Provides helper methods for managing plugins within the Dell Client Framework.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginHelper.GetPluginInfo(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns a PluginInfo object given a Type or null if none are found.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginHelper.GetPluginRequirements(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns a list of PluginRequires objects for the given pluginType.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginHelper.LoadPlugins(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginManager,System.Type,Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginHelper.LoadPluginCallback,Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log,System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method creates a list of plugin types and loads each type whose dependency requirements are met. As long as at least one plugin is loaded, we continue to check the entire list. What will remain in the list are any types that require plugins that are not loaded. Note, plugins with circular dependencies are not supported and will be left stranded in the list also.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginHelper.GetPluginLoadList(System.Type,Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log,System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method gets the initial plugin load list. It builds this list by looking for all interface types in this assembly, this assembly's directory, and the registry.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginHelper.GetPluginTypesFromAssembly(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Type}@,Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log,System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Type)
member.summary: Returns a list of plugin types from an Assembly that are of the specified classType.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginHelper.GetPluginTypesFromDirectory(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Type}@,Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log,System.String,System.String,System.Type)

member.summary: This delegate defines the callback that is used for the LoadPlugins method.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.IFrameworkPlugin
member.summary: This interface defines the methods that a plugin must implement in order to be loaded by the PluginManager.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginManager
member.summary: This class implements plugin management methods.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginManager.#ctor
member.summary: This is the default constructor for the PluginManager object.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginManager.AddPlugin(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.IFrameworkPlugin)
member.summary: This method adds a new plugin to the list of managed plugins.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginManager.AreRequiredIdsFound(System.Type)
member.summary: This method returns true if the given type's plugin requirements are found in the list of plugins. In other words, if this type requires other plugins, this method returns true if those plugins are currently in the active list. Also, the required version (if set) can not be greater than the plugin's version.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginManager.FindPluginByGuid(System.Guid)
member.summary: Returns a plugin interface with the specified Guid, or null if not found

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginManager.FindPluginById(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a plugin interface with the specified Id, or null if not found

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginManager.FindPluginByType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the first plugin interface with the specified interface type, or null if not found

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginManager.FindPluginsByType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns a list of plugin interfaces with the specified interface type.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginManager.RemovePlugin(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.IFrameworkPlugin)
member.summary: This method removes a plugin from the list of managed plugins.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginManager.RemovePlugins
member.summary: Remove all loaded plugins

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginManager.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of plugins currently loaded.

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.PluginManager.Plugin
member.summary: This class defines a plugin entry

member.name: T:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.RebootPolicy
member.summary: This object defines the policies that control how system reboots are presented to the user.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.RebootPolicy.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object with default values.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.RebootPolicy.NumDelays
member.summary: The number of time that the user is allowed to delay (or postpone) the reboot.
member.remarks: A value of zero means that the user will not be given the option to postpone the reboot. The default value is 5.

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.RebootPolicy.NumSecondsBetweenDelays
member.summary: The number of seconds allowed between each delay before presenting the reboot dialog again.
member.remarks: This value is ignored if NumDelays is zero. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).

member.name: P:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.RebootPolicy.NumSecondsBeforeShutdown
member.summary: The number of seconds to delay before an automatic shutdown/reboot occurs

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.SecureData.DeleteDataFromRegistry(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log,Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey,System.String)
member.summary: This is the plubic method that can be called to remove encrypted data from the registry

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.SecureData.LoadDataFromFile(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log,System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: This is the public method that can be called to load data from a secure state file. This method first attempts to load a version 2 state file (one encrypted with a unique machine key). If this fails, it will attempt to load with a version 1 file (which was not machine dependent). When the file is rewritten, it will be automatically upgraded to a version 2 format.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.SecureData.LoadDataFromRegistry(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log,System.Type,Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey,System.String)
member.summary: This is the plublic method that can be called to securely load encrypted data from the registry.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.SecureData.SaveDataToFile(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: This is the public method that can be called to save data to a secure state file. It will automatically save the serialized object in the most recent format.

member.name: M:Dell.Client.Framework.Common.SecureData.SaveDataToRegistry(Dell.Client.Framework.Common.Log,System.Object,Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey,System.String)
member.summary: This public method saves an object to the registry by storing an encrypted serialized XML string.
